docs.snippet: American tech companies study Chinese users and apps as a smartphone revolution changes how people interact, buy products and manage their money.

headline.main: China, Not Silicon Valley, Is Cutting Edge in Mobile Tech

docs.abstract: Innovations in China's tech industry, particularly its mobile businesses, are spurring imitators in Silicon Valley, even among giants; shift points to China's leading edge in global technologies and suggest it could have greater power in defining future direction of industry; mobile device usage in nation is highest in world.

docs.snippet: A student photojournalist started out documenting the lives of a couple who gave birth to quadruplets. She now plans to stay with the story until they turn 18.

headline.main: What Does Life With Quadruplets Look Like?

docs.snippet: This year is the fifth anniversary of Photoville, one of the country’s premier photo festivals, where an impressive range of images is exhibited inside shipping containers-turned-gallery spaces.

headline.main: Under the Brooklyn Bridge, the New Photoville

docs.abstract: This year is the fifth anniversary of Photoville, one of the country’s premier photo festivals, where an impressive range of images is exhibited inside shipping containers-turned-gallery spaces.

docs.snippet: Sony Corp will join the race for virtual reality (VR) dominance on Thursday with the $399 PlayStation VR, a headset the Japanese electronics group hopes will beat pricier rivals and revive its reputation as a maker of must-have gadgets.

headline.print_headline: Sony Enters Virtual Reality Race With PlayStation VR Headset
